> Now I wonder what is to be done to incorporate the JUnit-addons-runner
> into my cruisecontrol-setup. CC calls Ant which runs the normal
> JUnit-task to test success and to write a report in XML. Is there a way
> to run the tests by the junit-addons-runner and still getting an XML
> report including the ignored-list?

It's not finished but everything is in place:  the runner accepts custom 
listeners (like an XMLOutputter) and at the end of each run, a 
TestReport is sent.  What's to be done:
- write the XMLOutputter (and define the xml format)
- modify the TestReport so that getting infos for the output is as easy 
as possible
- write an XSL stylesheet to output HTML

(alternatively you can directly write an HTMLOutputter)

If you want to tackle the problem, you're welcome.

For further discussion, please use the JUnit-addons discussion groups 
(on the JUnit-addons SF page)

Thanks

-Vladimir
